description: From Middle English tho, tha, from Old English þā (“the, those”, plural), from Proto-Germanic *þai (“those”), from Proto-Indo-European *to-, *só (“that”). Cognate with Saterland Frisian do (“the”, plural).
From Middle English tho, tha, from Old English þā (“then, when”), from Proto-Germanic *þa- (“that”), from Proto-Indo-European *to-, *só (“that”). See also German da (“then, thereupon”).

examples: Tho went I near and found Master Reynard, that had left that he first read and sang, and began to play his old play.

description: Mostly found in American English; alteration of though. Compare tho'.

entries.meaning: (informal, chiefly US) Alternative spelling of though
